intro: Parochetus communis, commonly known as the common parochetus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Botanically, it is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to spread through rhizomes.
